results.title: How to play cricket by Don Bradman
results.brief_description: This unique film was first produced in England in 1934 with the script written and spoken by Don Bradman. It has been updated with comments by Sir Donald, filmed at his home in Adelaide in May 1993. Provides a rare opportunity for cricket lovers to study the master batsman’s technique in detail, and is an invaluable coaching aid to any aspiring cricketer. Bradman’s test match career was an outstanding example of sporting brilliance; his career total of runs was 6,996 with an average of 99.9, including 29 centuries. Aggression, initiative and improvisation were the hallmarks of his playing and this footage, filmed on the London Cricket Ground in 1934, captures his style perfectly, shows the complete shot and stroke broken down into successive movements and as such provides an invaluable visual description of how to achieve maximum effectiveness and efficiency of movements when batting in a game.

results.title: How to paint like a professional: a complete guide to interior painting.
results.brief_description: A practical guide to handy tips and techniques to achieve a professional interior painting job in your home. Terms like acrylic, enamel, pigment and sealer are clearly explained. Advice is given on the choice of paint, roller and brush, surface preparation, patching cracks, protecting floors and furniture, paint application, cleaning up after the job and storage of excess paint.

results.title: How to organise your own music event (PC)
results.creator_credit: Songlines Music Aboriginal Corporation, AUSMUSIC, Global Vision, Rory Sutton, Malcolm Smith and Diane Robbie
results.brief_description: Organise your own musical performance with the assistance of Rocky the Roadie. The CD ROM covers all details in the organisation of a musical performance, including budgeting, choosing the right venue, promotion and fundraising. The CD is based on a module ‘How to Organise Your Own Music Event’, which is part of AUSMUSIC’s Certificate 2 in Music Industry Skills. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC with 486 DX2/66 or higher, 640x480 display with 256 colors, 8 MB RAM, 16MB of free hard drive space, 4 speed CD ROM drive, Microsoft Windows 3.1 or a later version, and Video For Windows. A 140 page student workbook plus teacher notes accompanies the CD ROM and provides an overview to the piece as well as a glossary of terms, references and useful contacts.

results.title: How to negotiate a great salary package
results.brief_description: What this video lacks in glamorous production values, it more than makes up for in practical tips to negotiate the salary package you want from your employer. The program is in two segments, the first presented by Judy Rose who is experienced in negotiation skills. The second segment is presented by Mike Taylor of Prime Time Financial Counsellors who gives sound financial advice on options within salary packages. Produced for the Australian Institute of Training and Development.
